website_summaries.verdict: If value and reliability are your top priorities, consider this heavy-duty model.
pros: Sports interchangeable nozzles and plenty of power
Trigger is designed to fit 4 fingers to prevent hand cramping
cons: Some testers noted that it takes longer to heat up than expected
Glue occasionally gets clogged in the unit

customer_reviews.title: Tired of pulling your glue gun trigger really hard, only to watch the glue move at glacial speed?
customer_reviews.text: Tired of pulling your glue gun trigger really hard, only to watch the glue move at glacial speed? I am. This gun costs more than my DeWalt, but it requires less trigger pressure and moves far more glue faster. I am worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: terrycts

customer_reviews.title: Quality gun and fast heating!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to work on some Flight Test airplanes. The gun heats up fast and in ready to go within a few minutes. It pumps out a ton of glue and it does it hot enough that it allows you tons of time to get things where you want it before it sets. The included stand is a nice addition that keeps the gun elevated off your work surface and provides a stable base. The gun does not drop and or string really at all. There are cheaper hot glue guns out there, but this is the last one you will ever need to purchase. Great product and solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Wright

customer_reviews.title: I need to exchange this glue gun
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this glue gun, it leaks glue would like to return, please let me know what I can do.
customer_reviews.author: Delilah hasten

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: Heats very fast. Does not drip alot, but still drips occasionally unlike some others. Perfect for crafters. I make cat toys and some require use of a hot glue gun. I have gone through at least 5 guns in the years I have been in business. I use only the recommended high temperature glue sticks. While it is idle for a few minutes between applications the stick is ok, but sometimes the hot glue backs up through the top seal. then I need to scrape the excess off to continue using it. Is there a fix for this, or is the rubber seal defective? I can only return or exchange it until 1-31-2018.
customer_reviews.author: Personal and business guy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice glue gun
customer_reviews.text: Nice glue gun -- works very well and the glue is very hot when it comes out so be careful! This is NOT a normal craft store type of glue gun but works extremely well as long as you are careful. I use this glue gun to temporarily glue up boards when cutting multiple patterns on the bandsaw (chair arms etc. ). The nice thing about hot glue for that use is that as long as you don't use too much you can easily pry the pieces apart when you are done and remove the glue with a scraper.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in MA

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Industrial Glue Gun (AdTech 0189 Pro 200) and glue sticks as part of a foam board plane project. The glue gun doe not heat up enough (heating up for at least 15 minutes) to allow the glue to flow out of the nozzle easily. I usually have to use 2 hand and squeeze as hard as I can to get it to flow properly. I have tried different types of glue sticks (0.500 dia.) with about the same results. Would like a replacement to try again and see if I got the lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Green Thumb

customer_reviews.title: This thing is beast!
customer_reviews.text: First off, its big, but still really manageable. I have larger hands, so its nice to find something that my hands aren't cramping over. It delivers the glue very well, I've had a few cheap hobby hot glue guns, and they would stop feeding with over an inch of stick left. this thing almost makes the stick flush, you don't even realize your running out, but that's great because it actually leaves you room to feed a new stick in. I would and have recommended this gun to every hobbyist I know.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Edit failed response from manufacturer customer service
customer_reviews.text: Used it for just one hour so far but this gun is a beast. It heats super fast and provides a bead that lasts a bit longer than my other guns. I suspect it's the 200 watts. Awesome value, awesome quality. Edit. Realized i was missing the metal wire stand. Contacted manufacturer via email... respond they would send me one. Never happened... six weeks... should have just returned it. Huge manufacturer customer service fail.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wish they would have a 4.5 rating, but I will give them a 5.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as described, BUT the tip does drip slightly so do not rest the gun over anything you don't mind getting a little hot glue onto. melts like a champ and dispense nicely. the glue sticks do not always feed into the forward black rubber/silicone sleeve BUT I haven't tested other brands yet. Suggestion to manufacturer: extend the black silicone/rubber sleeve and use a more gradual inside taper OR increase the travel distance of the feed arm. Definitely a recommended buy as the above issues are not much of a nuisance and likely can be easily overcome with different glue sticks, more use, etc.
customer_reviews.author: TheOriginalFreak

customer_reviews.title: Works well, heats up fast
customer_reviews.text: This gun heats up faster than previous guns, and seems more sturdy and reliable. My prevoius hot glue gun clogged easily and eventually got damaged from the hot glue clogging and filling the inside. This gun does a good job of not letting that happen. One thing I wish this gun had was a rocker switch so the gun doesn't need to be constantly unplugged and plugged in for usage, but usage wise it probably is safer to fully unplug. Overall, excellent glue gun.
customer_reviews.author: Homer J

customer_reviews.title: Great glue gun
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the small glue guns. Heats up really fast !!!! I haven't had any issues with the dripping but I always put something underneath as a catchall just in case. If you do a lot of crafting or use a hot glue gun regularly then you should purchase this glue gun. Totally worth it. Not too heavy or awkward - its bigger but only takes a few minutes to get used too. Make sure you buy the correct glue sticks or else you will have issues. You need the FAT glue sticks - they can be long or short but DEFINITELY the fat sticks or they will just melt inside and not disperse the glue.
customer_reviews.author: Frank & Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Bought this in Oct 2017 actually used it very little ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Oct 2017 actually used it very little over 6 mo.s and now it is busted wont melt glue. Recomended highly by flight test but Epic Fail Just by the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.author: r a

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Unit heats up fast 1-2 min and you can get some glue out of it, 3-5 min and it flows really well . It doesn't drip much which is good and once it's really hot it can put out a lot of glue . The extra long sticks go fast if you have some big areas to glue . The only small issues are it's a big gun , the good things are little dripping , fast flow and heats up fast .
customer_reviews.author: Tool Maven

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it's just a glue gun, but this glue gun has been recommended by a lot of hobbyist and crafts, now this glue gun works great as well as some of the higher price ones out there. Now using the right glue stick for some jobs is also important. This glue gun has the tough and solid build to stand a 48 hour Foam Board model airplane assembly marathon for the weekend, Very Nice, Yes I would would recommend to anyone who wants mid price glue gun.
customer_reviews.author: clw2025

customer_reviews.title: Excellent glue gun
customer_reviews.text: I must have ten glue guns, many that I thought would be better than I have found them. This gun gun is the first reasonably priced glue gun that is actually worth its cost. Well built, balanced, excellent stand and hot as it should be. Very good wide "trigger". No fussy, unnecessary switches as found on too many glue guns .
customer_reviews.author: Andrewnyc

customer_reviews.title: Hot mama
customer_reviews.text: This thing here is Bad to the Bone. It heats up super fast,it dispenses super fast. Those little cheap guns I just not worth it. This thing will last a lifetime. For a few dollars more you really get the real thing. I don't use one much but when I use one I need one that works and this fits the bill perfectly. I would recommend this to anybody
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for woodworking
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this hot melt glue gun for a few months and it has been working great. I use it mostly for woodworking, as a quick temporary hold, or for workholding items that are odd shaped and cannot have extra holes put in them. It heats up fast and holds the heat very well. I have pushed up to 2 full sticks through for a glue up without loosing heat. The only thing I can ding it on is price, it is a bit more expensive than other options. I chose this one as the last one I would have to buy for awhile rather than being disappointed in a cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: Waylon Walker

customer_reviews.title: Quick to heat up does not slow down
customer_reviews.text: I needed a glue gun that could put out a LOT of glue. So far it is great, it gets hot very quick puts out glue as fast as I can squeeze the trigger. My old $5 glue gun could not keep up with me (even running two guns at a time) this one has not slowed down yet.
customer_reviews.author: JAW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hot glue gun
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by Flite Test, and I understand why. It has no problem producing large amounts of hot glue, and the glue is hot enough to allow it to be properly distributed before setting. Much better than the mini hot glue guns I've used in the past. Works perfectly for building remote control airplanes out of foam board (and wherever else I use hot glue).
customer_reviews.author: J. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great hot glue gun!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this gun when my white Anyyion 300W ($59.99) failed after 2 months. The Adtech has only one temp setting and no switch, but is otherwise superior in every way. Less drip, faster constant heating, built in stand. This is gun recommended and sold by FliteTest. com.
customer_reviews.author: The Silly Silverback

customer_reviews.title: The best I’be used!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hot glue gun. It heats up quickly and works well for the applications I use it for. In the time I’ve had it I’ve built six remote control airplanes from foam board, and all the glue joints I made with this gun have held. This is a top quality glue gun.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew of the Far North

customer_reviews.title: Sticky subject
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Heats up pretty quickly and turns glue sticks in to sticky stuff you can control very easily. Those insoles slide around in your sneakers? Stick 'em down. Put that liner in the lid of your camera case back where it belongs. Prototyping a science fiction movie prop? Plug this baby in and make it so.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Florey

customer_reviews.title: Not all that is pictured in the box
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a very good product, however my box did not contain the metal stand pieces as pictured on the box and the pictures here. Fine if I just missed what was supposed to be included.
customer_reviews.author: S Wayne Martin

customer_reviews.title: Leaky.
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty sure we got a defective glue gun. It is leaking out of every hole and crevice. It is glueing itself to the table as I am writing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets Hot Enough To Melt Glue Quickly & Thoroughly !
customer_reviews.text: This Hot Glue Gun Is Perfect For All Your Gluing Tasks. Gluing Wood Together, Gluing Emblems On The Inside Of Your Car or Use on it on Any Surface That Won't Be Damaged If or When The Glued Parts or Item Is Removed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Good Hot Glue Gun At A Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I like this glue gun a lot. It’s heats fast and doesn’t seem to drip very much. The only problem I found is that the trigger has a lot of slop, which causes you to get less glue per pull of the trigger. I 3D printed a block to fin in the trigger. Now it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Toolman

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Takes time to heat up. Hot glue keeps flowing out feed side and clogs up inner mechanism. Works best with the high heat glue sticks. For the higher cost of glue guns not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast
customer_reviews.text: Used today for the first time. I was pleased with the relatively short time from plug in until it was ready to go. I use hot glue to assemble firework rounds for a 37mm signal launcher. Craft store hot glue guns have always been slow to keep up and held the assembly time back. This one can keep up with the pace and has cut noticeable time off of assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Guy from TX

customer_reviews.title: Great glue gun.
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty, large capacity glue gun. It can deliver a lot of glue quickly. I really like the stand on the grip and the full trigger to reduce hand fatigue. I have other AdTech guns for smaller jobs. This one is for when I need a lot of glue for a project.
customer_reviews.author: Waynemia

customer_reviews.title: Fast Heating Easy to Handle
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic purchase! This gun is twice as hot as any other glue gun I've used. Its a full size but easy to handle and the stand actually works. This gun takes only a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: natasha smith

customer_reviews.title: It's great if you don't mind using it without the rubber handgrip.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber handgrip sticks to my hand better than it sticks to the glue gun. However, having said that, I really do like this glue gun. I did have a bit of an issue when I first got it trying to get it to feed the glue stick. I've now run 3 sticks through it and it seems to be working much better. The feeder would slip a bit when I first started using it but it works now. Who knows . . . may have been ESO (equipment superior to operator).
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty glue gun that delivers hot melt glue easily and does not drip very much. The stand that holds it up is a great idea. If you do a lot of hot melt glue work, this is the gun to get.
customer_reviews.author: RRLouis

customer_reviews.title: no more push
customer_reviews.text: i held the gun in storage for several months before i needed it. i pumped about a stick of glue and the handle quit. i could push the glue trough it. the gun junked out
customer_reviews.author: waihona

customer_reviews.title: Far Better Than the Many Glue Guns I've Used
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many glue guns and this is far better than any of them--a professional piece of equipment. Since it gets hotter, the glue bonds better. If you are going to glue something, make sure it holds. The gun is very well made and I expect it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: The Good, the True, and the Beautiful

customer_reviews.title: Also seems to take a good portion of the trigger pull before glue starts coming ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on being same model FlightTest Youtube guys use. Minus 1 star for wishing the 1 trigger pull pushed out more glue. Also seems to take a good portion of the trigger pull before glue starts coming out. No huge deal especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ttocs

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-Duty, Popular Price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice glue gun. It replaced one that wore out, but was not nearly as advanced. Like all good products, this is better than its predecessor. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Sander

customer_reviews.title: Used alot of glue guns, this one rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Good glue gun- and I'm a rock star with one...I've used them all. Very sturdy, good product, comfy handle, works well. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ROSEMARY PACHECO

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realiZe i needed An industrial hot glue gun. It really saves time and product because it gets the glue SO HOT you need less to create a puddle to hold together your items
customer_reviews.author: jonnyonthego

customer_reviews.title: This heats quickly and glues like right now
customer_reviews.text: This heats quickly and glues like right now. In fact, you have to work quickly or you cannot remove the item. We used it to glue stainless strap onto wood. It has held beautifully. I was amazed at how well. This is not like craft glue guns. You can easily burn yourself because the glue gets very hot. A great new tool for remodeling.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Lee

customer_reviews.title: Extra watt for extra hot
customer_reviews.text: 200 Watts is twice most hobbiests end up with. This one is able to handle larger jobs. The long tunnel allows the normal size glue tubes to be gripped tightly and not freeze up half way through. I have only practiced with it, but right now it is solid!
customer_reviews.author: Randy I

customer_reviews.title: Best glue gun!
customer_reviews.text: Best high temp glue gun ever! Use gorilla glue sticks with it. 400 degrees, watch your skin.
customer_reviews.author: veronica godshalk

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice gluegun very fine tip so it has good flow control only downside is trigger seems to be wearing out after a few months but still working
customer_reviews.author: jonathan west

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty glue gun. must use 8-10 inch glue sticks
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a glue gun that would last. Hoping I have it. I bought 8 inch glue sticks. It does need 8-10 inch glue sticks to operate at its best. I am hoping this thing is worth the money. I have had to many cheap glue guns that do not last.
customer_reviews.author: N. Dillard

customer_reviews.title: Most satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.text: This is an EXCELLENT glue gun and I'm so very pleased with it. It definitely exceeded my expectations. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Trigger broke after a week & a 1/2 of use. Will never buy this brand again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: bigger than the pic reflects
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice glue gun. It's bigger than you think and heats up quick.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: all the glue
customer_reviews.text: heats up quickly and once hit I can blow through sticks. Performs as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey alexander

customer_reviews.title: The Beast!!!
customer_reviews.text: Man this thing is a beast..I use glue guns a lot. This is one of the best I have ever used.NoDripping
customer_reviews.author: Phillip B.

customer_reviews.title: Hot product
customer_reviews.text: Best in the business but watch out for hot glue it burns
customer_reviews.author: Larry Chambless

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work much better than my $4.00 one from Michaels.
customer_reviews.author: E. Schuller

customer_reviews.title: Looks great BUT
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the construction but disappointed in the performance. Glue flow rate is minimal and the temperature seems low even on the high setting. My Stanley 80 watt glue gun outperforms this gun by a wide margin.
customer_reviews.author: James R

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good hot glue gun.. bought this to use at work to repair cabinets, it's been almost 2 year's now and still works good. Repair around 100 cabinets a day.
customer_reviews.author: curtis r.rone

customer_reviews.title: good trigger no finger cramps
customer_reviews.text: it's a hot glue gun hard to screw it up. the trigger is nice and bit so the fingers dont get tired. the plastic body feels durable
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Creed Ruble

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Really well built and HOT glue gun. My only negative on this is that it doesn’t have an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisC

customer_reviews.title: Certainly worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful - you can crank through glue sticks about as fast as you can load them.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter74

customer_reviews.title: Delivers hot glue like mad
customer_reviews.text: When it is time to get serious about hot glue, this is your glue gun. This thing will deliver hot glue at a rate of about 4-6 times that of a craft store hot glue gun. Unless you plan to glue all day you don't need anything more than this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L Evans

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Glue Gun
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hot glue gun I’ve ever used. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: Gluezilla!
customer_reviews.text: Completely awesome glue gun. The stuff I glue with this baby isn't going to come apart. I tested a piece that I glued in my oven to 200 degrees and the glue still held strong. I was just using Adhesive Technologies 220-11ZIP24 multi temp glue sticks for the test.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ross

customer_reviews.title: Hot and Sticky
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Commercial heat. Keep a bucket of water around during your project. Dip your hand in it if the lava hot glue gets on your fingers. Instant relief and no blisters. This is not a toy!
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Lava Gun
customer_reviews.text: This thing turns hot glue into lava so be careful. It works great but you need to give it a little more hold time as the glue is so hot it takes longer for it to cool down. Maybe I need better glue sticks but other than that it is working great for me.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Proof you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Heats fast. Great for big hands, no more cramping. Glad my daughter melted my old cheap one.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Great for foam board plane assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Gun works great. Front wire support was missing. I contacted Adhesive technologies. They mailed one quickly. Great customer support. This gun was recommended by the folks at Flite Test.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wedderburn

customer_reviews.title: Glue started coming out the side of gun!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this glue gun first one to last more than 3 months but before a year was even up the gun started pouring glue out the side of gun where there are slits cut in sides of gun. Hoping to get replacement there is a one year warranty. waiting to hear back from manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast!
customer_reviews.text: Great gun heats up fast. We use it in our shipping department.

customer_reviews.title: Medium duty; decent amount of hot glue.
customer_reviews.text: Heats up faster and will push out more hot glue than the hobby glue guns but not a professional gun. Sort of a mid range model.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I make electric model aircraft and use the pro-200 in the process. It heats fast and has a pinpoint nozzle for precise adhesive application. The delivery time was very timely!!
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Heats up insanely fast and stays hot with continuous use. I turned this into a air powered cobweb maker. This product is great if you are looking to do some serious hot gluing. Overall, the build quality seems very good. Nice and sturdy, not flimsy like those cheap ones from Walmart and other places.
customer_reviews.author: rupert haas

customer_reviews.title: This is way better than foam glue for airplanes
customer_reviews.text: OMG, this thing rocks. It will glue anything, quickly. I have messed around with the little 10 dollar glue guns, never thought they were good enough except for maybe some construction paper.. my son and I built two EPP foam airplanes in under an hour.. love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mogge

customer_reviews.title: It is the better one for its pricing.
customer_reviews.text: I am still having a problem with the tip, it appears to get block up now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Ken O.

customer_reviews.title: it has no battery
customer_reviews.text: it is glue gun. it heats up fast. the glue melts really good and it is really hot glue.
customer_reviews.author: MasterStylist

customer_reviews.title: Lots of hot glue
customer_reviews.text: Real nice unit. Very hot. It can dispense lots of glue without slowing down. The choice of stands is nice. Very little dripping ... though some.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Great product, lots of hot glue without waiting
customer_reviews.text: Great glue gun. But be careful, the glue that comes out is HOT!!! Not like a cheap glue gun, this glue will cause a serious burn. Don't ask how I know. You can put stick after stick in and it keeps the temp up.
customer_reviews.author: Fierce

customer_reviews.title: It is wonderful for me too
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband to build his airplanes etc.... He was thrilled. Guess who has built grow tunnels gluing the plastic around the 2x4 frames and no more flapping and tying down ends. It is wonderful for me too. They are now hinged and tight wonderful plastic. I can now store them with plastic on and ready to put back in fall or move to different bed. My netting and shade cloth tunnels will get the same treatments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Glue Gun for Heavier Applications
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic glue gun. I recommend you watch the YouTube video on how to easily remove the tiny bit of slack in the actuator lever so you can apply much longer beads without stopping.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Heats fast
customer_reviews.text: Heats fast. I really like that it has changeable nozzles. I need to buy an extended one to reach into tighter spaces.
customer_reviews.author: SMD

customer_reviews.title: Good glue gun
customer_reviews.text: Glue gun works well and glue flows well. No problem with this item
customer_reviews.author: Birdie123

customer_reviews.title: Super Duty Glue Gun
customer_reviews.text: Best 1/2 glue gun I have ever used. Saved $10 on open box model. It was in primo shape.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Great glue gun, it doesn't drip at all! good for heavy work
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: The glue doesn't stop coming...
customer_reviews.text: This thing can put out a serious amount of glue. Comes up to temp quickly. I couldn't ask for a better glue gun.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Woodard

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, easy to use, It comes with its own sand very sturdy, great for large projects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for making scratch built airplanes
customer_reviews.text: an exceptional glue gun compared to the little one that i have used for the previous 20 years. great for making scratch built airplanes
customer_reviews.author: L. Koeser

customer_reviews.title: posibly the best glue gun I ave ever owned
customer_reviews.text: posibly the best glue gun I ave ever owned. It heats up fast, can lay down a long bead of glue with each throw of the trigger, and has a great built in removable stand. It is larger than most glue guns. It feeds well and has a light to tell you its plugged in, that may not sound like much but most don't have it and I have left one plugged in for hours accidentally. the cord is a good lenght and the tips are replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: nickademusss

customer_reviews.title: The one to hold on
customer_reviews.text: Your job is as good as your tools are, I have used this glue gun for precision and high volume jobs, never let me down. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aidas

customer_reviews.title: my first glue gun
customer_reviews.text: I had this for many months now. It is a joy to use, i.e. it heats up fast, no mess, and easy to control the flow. I used it to build custom containers for some of my electronic items so that they will not get damages during transport.
customer_reviews.author: PParker

customer_reviews.title: The Tesla of glue guns
customer_reviews.text: All my life I've driven Honda Civics and now I'm driving a Tesla.......okay, I'm exaggerating but this is one fine glue gun!
customer_reviews.author: Tom A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Glue Gun
customer_reviews.text: Used on 4 RC Foam Board builds and it’s perfect for it. Warning you will melt skin with this but all my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Eurotraveller

customer_reviews.title: ... and it really heats up fast and provides a nice continuous flow of glue
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for several projects and it really heats up fast and provides a nice continuous flow of glue. The biggest challenge is feeding it sticks fast enough. I need longer sticks...
customer_reviews.author: CConti

customer_reviews.title: Great Glue Gun
customer_reviews.text: Excellent glue gun. I have had others that were frustratingly slow, but this model really pours out the glue. It makes doing craft projects much easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope Jarecke

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: excellent fast to heat up , maintains temperature well, excellent stand to keep it upright and good feed mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Best Glue Gun
customer_reviews.text: Best glue gun I have ever used and I run a makerspace at the library.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Schermacher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent glue gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice glue gun. Heats up quickly and puts out a lot of glue. I'm very happy with it and especially like the built in stand which holds it well.
customer_reviews.author: srj

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot quickly. Wish I could adjust the temperature ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets hot quickly. Wish I could adjust the temperature. It ended up melting the foam I was trying to glue if I wasn't careful. Returned for a different glue gun with adjustable temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Base stand was missing
customer_reviews.text: The gun is works great, however I am disappointed that the stand that attaches to the handle was missing. I'm going to have to make my own I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Christian M Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast!!! Works very well, stick it and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Geeky Mushroom

customer_reviews.title: I believe its the best gun for the price
customer_reviews.text: Owned this exact brand/model several times before and for our purpose it works perfectly. I believe its the best gun for the price..
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Throw away your 40Watt crafty
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!! Smooth flow of glue and helps me quickly get the job done!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mearlon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great glue gun. If you build flite test foamiesthis is the Gun for you. Done.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Blatchford

customer_reviews.title: We are very happy with our purchase for our garage business
customer_reviews.text: High quality glue gun. We are very happy with our purchase for our garage business.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great glue gun for serious work
customer_reviews.text: Best glue gun we have ever owned. Lives up to its name of "Pro." Heats up fast and just workhorses through projects, doesn't mind being dropped either. It's a brute.
customer_reviews.author: Artisan Auto Body

customer_reviews.title: Hundreds of uses
customer_reviews.text: Best glue gun I have ever used. Great product for building flite test style airplanes.
customer_reviews.author: richard Wesley

product_meta.title: AdTech Pro200 Industrial Strength Full Size High-Output Hot Melt Glue Gun (0189) – Professional Grade Hot Glue Gun for Carpentry, Repairs & Remodeling
product_meta.description:
AdTech 0189 Pro200 High-Output Hot Melt Glue Gun is a professional grade hot melt glue gun for light-industrial, commercial, and DIY applications. It features a powerful 200 Watt PTC Heating system that heats up to an operating temperature of 410°F/210°C in 3 minutes and can output 3. 5 lbs of glue per hour. Designed with a comfortable 4-finger trigger, durable high-quality shell, and sturdy base stand for long hours of use. AdTech Pro200 High-Output Hot Melt Glue Gun uses high temp, full-size, 0. 44 inch (12mm) glue sticks. From the Manufacturer: A US family-owned and operated company. AdTech Pro200 High-Output Full Size Hot Melt Glue Gun is a professional-grade hot melt glue gun for heavy-duty applications. Use on carpentry projects, repairs, DIY projects & remodeling. Proudly designed and engineered in the USA. Our hot melt glue gun features a powerful 200 Watt PTC Heating system that heats up to an operating temperature of 410°F/210°C in just three minutes and can output 3. 5 lbs of glue per hour. Designed for a comfortable grip with a 4-finger trigger design that requires less pressure than standard glue guns. The AdTech Pro200 Full Size High-Output Hot Melt Glue Gun works best with the AdTech Full Size High Temp Hot Melt Sticks but can also use any full-size, 0. 44 inch (12mm) high temp glue stick.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
One of the best glue gun values around. This heavy duty glue gun offers 200 watts of heater power and can deliver up to 3.5 pounds of glue per hour. Durable design, comfortable grip and trigger, and high volume glue output, all add up to an outstanding value!
feature_bullets: PROFESSIONAL-GRADE: The AdTech Pro200 Standard Size High-Output Hot Melt Glue Gun is powerful enough for carpentry, home repairs, DIY & remodeling projects.
DESIGNED FOR COMFORT: Features an ergonomic trigger for maximum grip and comfort. Requires less trigger pressure than standard hot glue guns. Plus, it comes with a sturdy built-in metal base stand.

MAXIMUM POWER: The Pro200 features a class leading 200 Watt PTC heating system with an operating temperature of 410°F/210°C that heats up in just 3 minutes and can output 3. 5 lbs of glue per hour. UL Certified to ensure safety.
WORKS BEST WITH ADTECH’S GLUE GUN STICKS: Use the AdTech Pro200 High-Output Hot Melt Glue Gun with AdTech’s Full Size High Temp Hot Melt Sticks. No harsh chemicals and acid-free.
HIGH QUALITY DESIGN: The AdTech Pro 200 features a durable shell made of high-quality, strong plastic, is designed and manufactured with the highest levels of quality and covered by a Money Back .

specifications.Warranty Description: This product is warranted to be free of manufacturer's defects in workmanship and material for one year, unless otherwise noted on package, beginning from the date of original retail purchase. This warranty does not cover any damages resulting from accident or misuse. If the product becomes defective within the warranty period, we will repair it or elect to replace it free of charge. We will return your product, provided it is delivered, transportation charges pre-paid, to Adhesive Technologies with proof of purchase. Repair or replacement as provided under this warranty is the exclusive remedy of the consumer. Adhesive Technologies shall not be liable for any incidental or consequential damages for breach of any express or implied warranty on this product. Any implied warranty of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose on this product is limited in duration to one year from date of purchase.
